bibl.title: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to R.C. Derivaux, January 20, 1926

div1.p: Fricks inquires whether Derivaux has any knowledge of Carter's statement regarding an unusual type of mosquito larvae.

div1.head: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to R.C. Derivaux, January 20, 1926
div1.opener:
EM
January 20, 1926.
Dr. R. C. Derivaux,
Vanderbilt University,
Lambuth Building,
Nashville, Tenn.
Dear Dr. Derivaux:
div1.p:
In reprint No. 156, “Malaria in North Carolina,”
by Dr. H. R. Carter, dated December 19, 1913, the follow-
ing statement occurs:

“A number of larvae were allowed to develop and
showed A. quadrimaculatus, A. crucians, and in
two places, Newbern and Plymouth, A. argyritarsis.”

This unusual finding of A. argyritarsis has been
brought to my attention, and I have discussed it with Mr.
LePrince in an effort to learn whether he ever heard it
referred to by Dr. Carter. I am wondering whether this
finding was ever mentioned to you by Dr. Carter, or whether
you know anything at all about it. If so, I would greatly
appreciate any information which you can give me on the
subject.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, L. D. Fricks, Surgeon,
Medical Officer in Charge. Same letter to Drs. Griffitts and Williams.
